instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02098: What is 820-02098? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CHGR_PHASE: What is CHGR_PHASE? CHGR_PHASE is charger voltage chopped up into individual slices prior to smoothing where it becomes PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after water damage 5v 0a no Magsafe light.
threads.message:
after cleaning:
PPBUS-12.2v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_AON_CHGR</SIGNAL> 12.2v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL> 1.3v
P3V8AON - 3.8v
ISL area look good and voltage around look o.k

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after water damage 5v 0a no Magsafe light.
threads.message:
It is recognized in DFU mode?
If not, check voltage on the coils around <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after water damage 5v 0a no Magsafe light.
threads.message:
not enter to DFU:
<CHIP>U7700</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S2</SIGNAL> -0v
<SIGNAL>PPVDD_DISP_AWAKESW</SIGNAL> short.. diode mode 0.005 good board show 0.0771 there after injection 1.5v there now its 0.0185

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after water damage 5v 0a no Magsafe light.
threads.message:
May have a problem with <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>, a filter cap, or M1.
Check first <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> LDOs; pages 41 & 37.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after water damage 5v 0a no Magsafe light.
threads.message:
PP1V8 LDO is missing no short.
the water damage was at area of:
UD600
RD650
<CAPACITOR>C8100</CAPACITOR>-103-replaced
<CHIP>U8440</CHIP>
UT000
i was reball and clean all.
no short found

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after water damage 5v 0a no Magsafe light.
threads.message:
Do you mean <SIGNAL>PP1V8_AON</SIGNAL>?
In such case, <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> is the first suspect.
Can also have bad solders underneath; try reballing it first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after water damage 5v 0a no Magsafe light.
threads.message: i was reball <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>  but the same...i don't have any 1v8 on board..
